meanings.definition: On or toward the side sheltered from the wind.
meanings.sent1: The tent was set up on the leeward side of the hill to avoid the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors preferred to anchor their boat on the leeward side of the island for protection.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket kept flying away until they placed it on the leeward side of the tree.
meanings.sent4: She found solace in the leeward corner of the library, away from the noisy students.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin nestled in the leeward valley, shielded from the harsh elements.

meanings.definition: The side sheltered from the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailors enjoyed the calm waters on the leeward of the island.
meanings.sent2: The trees on the leeward of the mountain grew tall and strong.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek on the leeward of the playground equipment.
meanings.sent4: The animals sought refuge in the leeward of the barn during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cottage was nestled in the leeward of the valley, protected from the gusty winds.
